Package com.intellij.lang.folding

Class CustomFoldingBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.lang.folding.FoldingBuilderEx
      • com.intellij.lang.folding.CustomFoldingBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FoldingBuilder, PossiblyDumbAware
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CustomFileTypeFoldingBuilder, GroovyFoldingBuilder, JavaFoldingBuilderBase, MarkdownFoldingBuilder, PropertiesFoldingBuilder, PythonFoldingBuilder, XmlCodeFoldingBuilder, YAMLFoldingBuilder

    public abstract class CustomFoldingBuilder
extends FoldingBuilderEx
implements PossiblyDumbAware
    Builds custom folding regions. If custom folding is supported for a language, its FoldingBuilder must be inherited from this class.

    • Method Detail

      • buildFoldRegions

        public final FoldingDescriptor [] buildFoldRegions(PsiElement root,
                                                   Document document,
                                                   boolean quick)
        Description copied from class: FoldingBuilderEx
        Builds the folding regions for the specified node in the AST tree and its children.
        Specified by:
        buildFoldRegions in class FoldingBuilderEx
        Parameters:
        root - the element for which folding is requested.
        document - the document for which folding is built. Can be used to retrieve line numbers for folding regions.
        quick - whether the result should be provided as soon as possible. Is true, when an editor is opened and we need to auto-fold something immediately, like Java imports. If true, one should perform no reference resolving and avoid complex checks if possible.
        Returns:
        the array of folding descriptors.

      • buildFoldRegions

        public final FoldingDescriptor [] buildFoldRegions(ASTNode node,
                                                   Document document)
        Description copied from interface: FoldingBuilder
        Builds the folding regions for the specified node in the AST tree and its children. Note that you can have several folding regions for one AST node, i.e. several FoldingDescriptor with similar AST node.
        Specified by:
        buildFoldRegions in interface FoldingBuilder
        Overrides:
        buildFoldRegions in class FoldingBuilderEx
        Parameters:
        node - the node for which folding is requested.
        document - the document for which folding is built. Can be used to retrieve line numbers for folding regions.
        Returns:
        the array of folding descriptors.

      • buildLanguageFoldRegions

        protected abstract void buildLanguageFoldRegions(java.util.List<FoldingDescriptor> descriptors,
                                                 PsiElement root,
                                                 Document document,
                                                 boolean quick)
        Implement this method to build language folding regions besides custom folding regions.
        Parameters:
        descriptors - The list of folding descriptors to store results to.
        root - The root node for which the folding is requested.
        document - The document for which folding is built.
        quick - whether the result should be provided as soon as possible without reference resolving and complex checks.

        Parameters:

      • isCustomRegionStart

        public final boolean isCustomRegionStart(ASTNode node)
        Returns true if the node corresponds to custom region start. The node must be a custom folding candidate and match custom folding start pattern.
        Parameters:
        node - The node which may contain custom region start.
        Returns:
        True if the node marks a custom region start.

      • isCustomRegionEnd

        protected final boolean isCustomRegionEnd(ASTNode node)
        Returns true if the node corresponds to custom region end. The node must be a custom folding candidate and match custom folding end pattern.
        Parameters:
        node - The node which may contain custom region end
        Returns:
        True if the node marks a custom region end.

      • isCustomRegionElement

        protected static boolean isCustomRegionElement(PsiElement element)

      • isCustomFoldingCandidate

        protected boolean isCustomFoldingCandidate(ASTNode node)
        Checks if a node may contain custom folding tags. By default returns true for PsiComment but a language folding builder may override this method to allow only specific subtypes of comments (for example, line comments only).
        Parameters:
        node - The node to check.
        Returns:
        True if the node may contain custom folding tags.

      • isCustomFoldingCandidate

        public final boolean isCustomFoldingCandidate(PsiElement element)

      • isCustomFoldingRoot

        protected boolean isCustomFoldingRoot(ASTNode node)
        Checks if the node is used as custom folding root. Any custom folding elements inside the root are considered to be at the same level even if they are located at different levels of PSI tree. By default the method returns true if the node has any child elements (only custom folding comments at the same PSI tree level are processed, start/end comments at different levels will be ignored).
        Parameters:
        node - The node to check.
        Returns:
        True if the node is a root for custom foldings.

      • isDumbAware

        public boolean isDumbAware()
        Checks if the folding ranges can be created in the Dumb Mode. In the most of language implementations the method returns true, but for strong context-dependent languages (like ObjC/C++) overridden method returns false.
        Specified by:
        isDumbAware in interface PossiblyDumbAware
        Returns:
        True if the folding ranges can be created in the Dumb Mode
